response:
Optic neuritis plus partial myelitis in a middle-aged woman most strongly suggests relapsing–remitting MS; NMOSD and MOGAD are key alternatives. Compressive thoracic cord lesions must be excluded urgently; other inflammatory/infectious mimics considered.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing\u2013remitting multiple sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (AQP4-IgG positive)", "MOG antibody\u2013associated disease", "Compressive thoracic cord lesion (disc/meningioma/epidural pathology)", "Idiopathic transverse myelitis", "Spinal cord sarcoidosis", "Vitamin B12 deficiency (subacute combined degeneration)", "Neurosyphilis"]
